intro: Chaetogastra nigritella, commonly known as the black-stemmed chaetogastra, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and have a distinctive hairy texture. It is primarily valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
